info.headline: Freeze Watch issued December 30 at 12:16PM PST until January 02 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Temperatures in the lower 30s possible. * WHERE...Eastern portion of Joshua Tree National Park, Imperial Valley, Palo Verde Valley and Chuckwalla Valley. * WHEN...From Saturday evening through Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions could kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
